thread.title: Five of the best ever soap comebacks as Helen Flanagan returns to Coronation Street
thread.title_full: Five of the best ever soap comebacks as Helen Flanagan returns to Coronation Street

author: Mark Jefferies
title: Five of the best ever soap comebacks as Helen Flanagan returns to Coronation Street
text:
TV Five of the best ever soap comebacks as Helen Flanagan returns to Coronation Street The 26-year-old actress has spent five years away from the soap as her character went to pursue a modelling career in America Share Rosie arrives back on the Corrie cobbles Share Get soaps updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Helen Flanagan is returning to the cobbles of Coronation Street five years after she walked out on her role as Rosie Webster. 
The 26-year-old actress has spent five years away from the soap as her character went to pursue a modelling career in America. 
But things in Miami didn't quite go to plan for Sally and Kevin's eldest girl and now she's back on the street with a suitcase packed full of touble 
Helen Flanagan is far from the first big name star to make a comeback after years away from a soap. 
As she returns as Rosie Webster here are five other memorable returns: Read More First look at Helen Flanagan's explosive return to Coronation Street as she's back on the cobbles Leslie Grantham returned as Dirty Den (Photo: Press Association) Den Watts - Over 17 million people tuned in to watch Dirty Den rise from the dead. Actor Leslie Grantham was killed off in 1989 but made a surprise return in 2003. Liz McDonald – Actress Beverley Callard quit Corrie in 2011 but returned in 2013 after beating depression. Beverley Callard who plays Liz McDonald (Photo: ITV) Harold Bishop – Died on Neighbours in 1991 but later the Aussie – played by Ian Smith – made an astonishing comeback in 1996 after having apparently survived. Harlod Bishop returned from the dead (Photo: BBC) Nick Cotton – Left Albert Square in 2001 but actor John Altman returned seven years later and claimed to be a changed man. Actor John Altman came back as Nasty Nick (Photo: DAILY MIRROR) Bet Lynch – actress Julie Goodyear returned to the Street in a blaze of glory in 2002 after a seven year absence but the comeback didn’t last long. Julie Goodyear's return was short lived (Photo: Daily Mirror) Like us on Facebook
